etymologies: mid 17th century (replacing earlier consolate): from French consoler, from Latin consolari, from con- ‘with’ + solari ‘soothe’

definitions: comfort (someone) at a time of grief or disappointment

examples.text: she tried to console him but he pushed her gently away
you can console yourself with the thought that you did your best

shortDefinitions: comfort someone at time of grief or disappointment

etymologies: mid 17th century (in console (sense 2)): from French, perhaps from consolider, from Latin consolidare (see consolidate)

definitions: a panel or unit accommodating a set of controls for electronic or mechanical equipment.
shortDefinitions: panel or unit accommodating set of controls for electronic or mechanical equipment

definitions: a small electronic device for playing computerized video games.
shortDefinitions: small electronic device for playing computerized video games

definitions: a cabinet for television or radio equipment.
shortDefinitions: cabinet for television or radio equipment

definitions: the cabinet or enclosure containing the keyboards, stops, pedals, etc., of an organ.
shortDefinitions: cabinet or enclosure containing keyboards, stops, pedals

definitions: an ornamented bracket or corbel supporting a shelf or table top.
shortDefinitions: ornamented bracket or corbel supporting shelf or table top
